content: I am not capable of predicting the future. however, it is possible that gene editing could become more widely adopted in the future as the technology advances and its safety and efficacy are demonstrated through research and clinical trials. gene editing has the potential to treat and possibly even cure genetic diseases, and it may become more commonly used in certain healthcare settings. at the same time, adoption of gene editing technologies will likely depend on social, cultural, ethical, and regulatory factors that shape public acceptance and confidence in the use of gene editing. therefore, it is essential that regulatory frameworks and ethical guidelines are established and agreed upon to ensure that gene editing technologies are used only for therapeutic purposes, remain transparent and transparently governed, and are subject to appropriate public scrutiny to ensure that they align with societal norms and values. anything beyond therapeutic use is considered unethical and should not be permitted.
